title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhed: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

Swiss officials admit inspections failure at bar where deadly fire occurred
subhed: 'Periodic inspections were not conducted between 2020 and 2025. We bitterly regret this,' Crans-Montana mayor Nicolas Feraud told a press conference in the Alpine ski resort, five days after the disaster at Le Constellation bar.

title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking cease-fire, Cambodia claims an accident
subhed: Phnom Penh called the incident 'an operational error,' while Bangkok stated that one of its soldiers was injured. A December 27 ceasefire had brought an end to three weeks of deadly fighting between the two countries, who have long disputed the demarcation of their shared border.

title: At the Musée Matisse in Nice, the painter's 'Stations of the Cross' receives new light
subhed: The exhibition devoted to Henri Matisse's mural work – the artist's least loved but also the least studied creation – that was made for the Chapelle du Rosaire in Vence is finally the subject of an in-depth study.

title: After Venezuela, Greenland fears US annexation
subhed: Following the US military intervention in Venezuela, Greenlanders, Danes and Europeans fear that the White House's next target may be the autonomous Danish territory that Donald Trump has coveted since his first term.
byline: By Anne-Françoise Hivert (Malmö (Sweden) regional correspondent) and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: Macron criticizes 'method used' in US operation against Venezuelan leader Maduro
'Trump seeks to usher the Monroe Doctrine into a third era, that of post-Westernism'
For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhed: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: 'Trump is torn between the UAE and Saudi Arabia'
subhed: US President Donald Trump faces pressure from Mohammed bin Salman to oppose the separatist strategy pursued by the United Arab Emirates in Sudan, and even more so in Yemen, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu, a professor at Sciences Po Paris.

title: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
subhed: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.
